The Ile-Ife theft, which included three bronze heads, was the second in less than two years. Ile-Ife, one of the most important and ancient cities of Yoruba, is widely known for its rich culture and traditional artifacts. The city is considered as the cradle of the Yoruba and all Yorubas claim that they descended from lle-lfe. The Ile-Ife theft, which included three bronze heads, was the second in less than two years. How- ever, 13 other earlier sacked or suspended were said to have been "forgiven" and recalled back to duties "having been cleared of the charges levelled against them." Sunny Odion Sunny Odion

The State Investigation Intelli- gence Bureau[SIIB], Yaba is now set to unravel the mystery surround- ingthe grues ome death of a medical doctor. The policeauthorities, apparently haunted by the restless ghost of the doctor who reportedly died last year in circumstances which seemed too unnatural; have set up a special team to resolve the puzzle. A hostess with the Nigerian Air- ways is amongsuspects already helping the police in the investigation of the case. The suspect, who is simplyiden- tified as "Halima," is being kept in the police custody alongside her "sugar daddy" simply named "Alhaji". The victim named as Dr. Peter Ugwumadu until his untimely death, was believed to have been a lover of the hostess. PMNews learnt that the latter gladly offered the deceased the keys to the tastefully furnished flat which was then vacant, asking him to always check in at night, and promising to be coming regularly to keep his company. Investigations further revealed that the late doctor, however, did not know the said flat was originally rented and furnished by the Alhaji said to be Halima's "sugar-daddy. The quarters was meant to be their "love nest." To prevent the abode being put to other use, the Alhaji was said to have told the landlady to watch out for any interlopersince he came around once in a while. Playing the "observant" sentinel, the landlady was believed to have tipped off the Alhaji about the "nightintruder". The Alhaji was said to have been enraged by the report. Meanwhile, the hearing of the case has been fixed for 27, January 1995 at the Yaba Magistrate Court. Airways employee as they were "still in love". 42 South African Prisoners Escape 42 South African Prisoners Escape

Forty-two prisoners, some of them murderers and robbers, were on the run yesterday afterstagingjail breaks from three prisons in South Africa's KwaZulu Natal province, a Correctional Services spokesman said yesterday. Forty-two prisoners, some of them murderers and robbers, were on the run yesterday afterstagingjail breaks from three prisons in South Africa's KwaZulu Natal province, a Correctional Services spokesman said yesterday.

P A total of 54 prisoners broke out of the three jails on Christmas Eve but 1 have since been arrested, the spokesman, Major Koos Gerber said. P A total of 54 prisoners broke out of the three jails on Christmas Eve but 1 have since been arrested, the spokesman, Major Koos Gerber said.
Gerber blamed a go-slow by the Police and Prisons Civil Rights (POPCRU) for two of the jail breaks: Gerber blamed a go-slow by the Police and Prisons Civil Rights (POPCRU) for two of the jail breaks:

d J - from Ncome prison near the northern farming town of Vryheid where 16 prisoners got out unnoticed by the two warders who were on duty; and - from a prison in the provincial capital Pietermaritzburg, where seven prisoners escaped by using bedsheets to fashion a rope and lower themselves to freedom after breaking out of their cell. d J - from Ncome prison near the northern farming town of Vryheid where 16 prisoners got out unnoticed by the two warders who were on duty; and - from a prison in the provincial capital Pietermaritzburg, where seven prisoners escaped by using bedsheets to fashion a rope and lower themselves to freedom after breaking out of their cell.

35 Sierra Leonean Prisoners Freed Some 35 prisoners have been freed after receiving a Christmas Day pardon fr their president, Captain Valentine Strasser, prison officials said in Freeto yesterday. 35 Sierra Leonean Prisoners Freed Some 35 prisoners have been freed after receiving a Christmas Day pardon fr their president, Captain Valentine Strasser, prison officials said in Freeto yesterday.

yesterday, Four of the 35 had been sentenced to death in October 1987 for attempt against the regime of then president) Joseph Momoh, the officialssaid That regime was overthrown in a coup in April 1992 led by Captain Strasser. The four's death sentences had earlier been commuted to life in prison. The other 31 prisoners freed on Sunday were jailed for committing offences under ordinary criminal legislation, the prison board officials added. yesterday, Four of the 35 had been sentenced to death in October 1987 for attempt against the regime of then president) Joseph Momoh, the officialssaid That regime was overthrown in a coup in April 1992 led by Captain Strasser. The four's death sentences had earlier been commuted to life in prison. The other 31 prisoners freed on Sunday were jailed for committing offences under ordinary criminal legislation, the prison board officials added.
